headline: Burrito Pie
description: Ground beef, refried beans and tomatoes are combined with chiles and taco sauce, then layered in a casserole with tortillas and cheese, and baked.

video.description: This spicy casserole features layers of seasoned beef, beans, cheese, and tortillas.
video.name: Burrito Pie

name: Burrito Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (4 ounce) can diced green chili peppers
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the ground beef for 5 minutes. Add the onion and garlic, and saute for 5 more minutes. Drain any excess fat, if desired. Mix in the olives, green chile peppers, tomatoes with green chile peppers, taco sauce and refried beans. Stir mixture thoroughly, reduce heat to low, and let simmer for 15 to 20 minutes.

Spread a thin layer of the meat mixture in the bottom of a 4 quart casserole dish. Cover with a layer of tortillas followed by more meat mixture, then a layer of cheese. Repeat tortilla, meat, cheese pattern until all the tortillas are used, topping off with a layer of meat mixture and cheese.
Bake for 20 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cheese is slightly brown and bubbly.

review.reviewBody: Husband and I thought this was delicious. I only used 1 can of beans & ground chicken. Very good.

This is a great, easy recipe. It’s like Mexican lasagna. Halve the recipe for a standard 9X11 pan. I used salsa and I mixed the beans with the meat mixture. Very easy and very good, a quick and easy dish for a group.
My son did not like the olives, and we left out the green chili's. Over all the family liked it.

This is a family favorite, I'd rather have this than eat a burrito in a restaurant. For our family of four, I cut the recipe in half. I don't mix the refried beans in with the meat. For the layers, I do the following in a 13"x9"x2" - a very light layer of meat just so things don't stick on the bottom. Two flour tortillas smeared with refried beans. 1/2 the meat mixture. Some sour cream and shredded cheese. Repeat. Then top with two flour tortillas smeared with refried beans face down, top with a light layer or sour cream and shredded cheese. Then sliced olives on the half for those who like them. After serving, I top mine with lettuce so I feel healthier :) Yum!!
Super delicious! I increased the amount of cheese and added diced green onion when it was ready to serve. Second one made in 2 weeks!

Very tasty. I made it to the recipe except that I made it in a 9x13 pan (typical lasagna pan). I used 8" flour tortilla and cut them in half to cover all of the 9x13 space for each layer. I think the recipe was a little light on the cheese and I used more than the recipe called for. It's important to have the cheese on the top of each layer to help the whole thing stick together (the cheese sticks to the layer of tortilla above it. The recipe filled the 9x13 pan and was enough for four layers separate by three layers of tortillas. Very good and I'll make it again.
We made this last night and it was bomb!

My husband liked this recipe, but I didn't so much thus, for the 4 stars. Only used 1 can of refried beans since I do not like them. Certainly less pasty in texture for sure. 
Thank you for the recipe.
Easy n good! I baked mine in a pie Dish but forgot to take a photograph.
I will be making this again, will do just a little tweaking, but I loved it.
It was delicious. All I added was extra cumin and Litehouse jalapeños. Sooooo good! ??
Followed some other reviewers simple suggestions and this was a hit! My family loved it!
Delicious! I had corn tortillas instead of flour so I went with them instead. Otherwise followed the recipe.

Made it tonight for dinner. Changed it a bit because we don't like spicy foods. We used regular diced tomatoes and mild taco sauce, also only used medium cheddar. It was really good. Family says I can make this one again.

Loved it and so did everyone at Shabbat Dinner. I used 1 lb of ground beef and 1 lb of ground turkey. I added Spanish Rice and corn as well as Salsa Verde instead of just green chillies. And... I threw in a packet of taco seasoning. Next time I am going to exchange the flour tortillia for a corn tortillia, only because the tortillia got a little gummy for me. I am not a big burrito fan, because of the tortillia.

This is going to become a family staple. Not only delicious, but makes enough to freeze for another meal.

I used 1 lb each of hamburger & ground turkey to cut some calories and Ole Mexican Ole Xtreme Wellness! Tortilla Wraps (50 cal each) and it only took 8 instead of 12.

Served with sour cream and shredded cheddar and a little chopped lettuce & tomato on the side. FANTASTIC!
Quick and simple. With 3 teens I didn’t have 14 servings...lol! I made the taco sauce from scratch using Allrecipes . The fam said make again.

Loved how fast and easy this recipe was! Only thing I would suggest would be to crisp up the tortillas before layering them or adding in some crushed tortilla chips when serving for an extra crunch factor!

We ate it... and ate it... and kept eating it... and every bite we hated it more. The texture was not good. The flavor was meh, which didn't make up for the poor texture. By the time we got to the third day of leftovers, neither of us was willing to eat it again
Okay as is - took advice from previous reviewers and subbed black beans for the refried and doubled up on the tortillas; that brought it up to a 5.
Best and easy Mexican dish to make. Put sour cream and shredded lettuce on top and serve.
This is a good, easy recipe. I made a few changes to the recipe, I used pepper jack cheese, used more garlic & salsa. Everyone enjoyed the dish.
Didn’t have any cans of chili’s but substituted it for a can of petite diced tomatoes. And used 1 can of refried beans? instead. Turned out delicious!! Yummy!! The family loved it!!
Great, my family used street tacos and it was fabulous with them.
Best dish we ever made.

This was an amazing recipe! I made it as directions with just a few modifications. I cooked diced green and red pepper along with the onion and garlic to make it healthier. I also added a can of corn and did regular diced tomatoes instead of the ones with green chiles to make it a little sweeter. We found that it tasted better as a leftover after cooling in the fridge overnight- maybe because the ingredients had time to set together? Overall this is an amazing recipe! I'm sure it is just as good without the changes I made if you like spice/don't like peppers.
This is amazing but I added a Tbs of Tomato chicken bouillion and only one can of refried beans. SO delicious.
The best burrito I ever ate. Easy to make. Not very spicy. I shared it with 3 neighbors and they enjoyed it too.

Easy dinner! Made this for my husband and Dad and they loved it!! A few changes, corn tortillas instead of flour and only 1 can of refried beans. I added the refried beans directly on the corn tortillas, per the other reviews and it turned out great!! We topped with salsa, sour cream, chives, and (for something sweet) Catalina dressing. Yum, easy and left us with leftovers. Really easy and delicious. I will defiantely be making this again.

This was delicious and I will make this a regular meal. The only changes that I made was I used ground chicken instead of ground beef and I skipped the black olives since I don’t like them. My hubby really love this one too.
Made it with Vegetarian Meat Grounds, and I suggest replacing the refried beans with vegetarian chili.

BOMB!! Tastes like Taco Bell’s Mexican Pizza. I subbed for ground turkey (it’s all I had) and did regular diced tomatoes without chili’s (cuz kids) but it was AMAZING!! Will be making it again. Thank you!!

Everyone had 3rd helpings with a few changes! I added taco seasoning to the meat and omitted the refried beans and taco sauce until later - I also added diced jalapenos to the meat because we like a good kick of spice, and about a half cup of frozen corn. As another user said, let simmer for at least 15 minutes to let the flavors meld. I then layered the meat mixture, tortillas, refried beans, taco sauce, cheese and a few olives. Then repeated these layers a few times- these separate layers helped tone down the mushiness. Then top with sour cream and avocado slices - definitely not low on flavor!

I've had this recipe on my menu for a long time but it seemed that every night it was scheduled something came up so I never got to make it. Tonight I finally excitedly made this with a few modifications. I was very disappointed. Had I not made my modifications I don't think this would have even been eaten in my house (seasoning the meat and doubling the tortillas to avoid mushiness). The refried beans were completely overpowering and the mixture was like eating mush. There wasn't a spicy kick as I'd expect either. While it wasn't horrible it just wasn't good. For the work and price of all the ingredients I dont think it's worth even trying to fix. We'll stick to a layered burrito casserole and just regular burritos. I really wanted to like it, I don't get the high reviews.

Reduced this in half. So easy and Tasty . I used 6 tortillas and got 6 serving from this. Browned the beef with onion. Stirred the rest of the ingredients together and started layerings. Tortilla,, Meat bean mixture, black olives, cheese. It was 6 layers with the meat and cheese on top. I did add fajita seasoning and I only had mozzarella cheese on hand and it worked just fine. 2 to eat and 4 in the freezer. Happy cook.
We loved it and will definitely be making it again and again! I omitted the black olives and used shredded cheddar (lots of it). Also, I used 10 inch soft flour tortillas.
This was delicious! I added enchilada sauce because it was all I had, but it was excellent and filling. I added some hot sauce because it was on the bland side. Loved it!
Hubby and I really enjoyed it! Even the 4 & 2 year old ate it fairly well. I did omit the can of green chiles to make sure it didn't get too spicy for the kids.

This recipe turned out as I had hoped! It was tasty, the consistency was perfect, the cheese on top melted just right at the time and temperature suggested. I had no intent on changing the ingredients, but due to quantities of what I had, I used half the sauce & less ground beef than asked for.
We loved it. Always looking for different recipes to make on Taco Tuesday and found this. Love, love, love it. We did use the Hot Ortega Taco sauce-we like the extra heat.
Doubled the tortillas, used half a can of mild green chilies, didn't use olives (Because they're disgusting, lol) and used Taco Bell's Taco Sauce - found it at walmart) Very tasty!

I did not change the recipe the first time I made it, but to say I loved it, I would say to add 1/2 of what the recipe calls for of Taco Sauce to make the pie chunkier. I like pizza pies with chunkier toppings, and less taco sauce would be one way to reduce the liquid consistency in this recipe.

I did not change the recipe the first time I made it, but to say I loved it, I would say to add 1/2 of what the recipe calls for of Taco Sauce to make the pie chunkier. I like pizza pies with chunkier toppings, and less taco sauce would be one way to reduce the liquid consistency in this recipe.

I did not change the recipe the first time I made it, but to say I loved it, I would say to add 1/2 of what the recipe calls for of Taco Sauce to make the pie chunkier. I like pizza pies with chunkier toppings, and less taco sauce would be one way to reduce the liquid consistency in this recipe.
Absolutely delicious! Thanks for sharing!

I made this a week ago, and wow! My husband, oldest son and I, we ate it up! It was a bit spicy, but I may have overdone it in the taco sauce. I made it to my family’s taste, not using olives and such. I cooked it in a 13x9 casserole dish, like a lasagna for about 30 minutes. It will be made again and again.

No one in my family was impressed with this recipe. We found it quite bland. There are other versions that we have tried that were much more flavorful. Love the idea of this meal just not this version.
nice new taste
Certainly not low carb, but it is good. I suggest making it your own on the spices.
So easy and so good
No changes I followed the recipe very good everyone loves it forgot to take picture yes I will make it again
Totally awesome
very tasty and easy. hubby loves anything Mexican so this one's a keeper!
I would definitely make again! Everything was perfect, I made it without olives though
This was yummy! Will make again, had to tone down on spiciness for family members but still very good.
I thought this was okay. I think it would be a kid pleaser on a week night after practice for sure.
yes, very easy & delicious

We loved this dish. I did add a packet of original Taco Seasoning to the meat! I'm glad I did. Thanks for the recipe! I topped the serving with shredded lettuce, black olives, avocado, garden onions and baby tomatoes. Looked and tasted great!
Amazing! Next time I’ll add more olives, but this is simply amazing and so easy to make!
loved this recipe...added just a little more heat

We loved this . . . made it for my family and a few friends, was a hit! I made it in a large stainless steel pan. Had chopped tomatoes, shredded lettuce, sliced avocados, sour cream and queso for toppings. I was really impressed!!

The recipe didn’t call for any seasonings. I added my own and eyeballed it with cumin, pepper, chili seasoning, oregano, and Goya adobo seasoning. I used corn tortillas for an authentic taste. I love flour tortillas usually. I layered a few tortillas as one previous reviewer suggested. It came out pretty good but don’t put any tortillas on top or they’ll crisp up. I would make again for myself but I don’t think it looks good enough to serve a guy-friend.
Loved it!!
Love this! Nice option for when I don't know what to make for dinner. Next time I will try frying the tortillas first for a little crunch.
Always love me a nice, cheesey burrito pie!
My family loves this. Made an extra one for the freezer and it turned out just as good as the first one. Thank you for sharing your recipe!

Really good! The only change I made to the recipe is that instead of adding 2 cans of refried beans to the meat mixture, I used one can (not a refried bean fan)as a separate layer on top of the tortillas(at the suggestion of a previous reviewer). Next time I’ll double up the tortilla layer (another reviewer suggestion).

I made recipe "as directed" 
(4 servings). My husband really liked it as did I. When I plated 
mine, I topped with more raw 
onion, a little salsa & sour 
creme! It really is a great 
recipie, thanks so much for sharing. This one is a definite keeper!!
We added I package of Taco seasoning mix to the original ingredients. It was very good.
I love it it is almost like a taco pie I make
Super easy to make and very tasty. My boys destroyed the whole batch. I'll defiantly make this again.
Easy, I made in 2 pie pans-froze 1 and enjoyed the other
this was awesome

This dish was yummy. I followed the recipe pretty much the way it was written. The only thing that I didn't add was olives because my kids don't like olives. I might add some mexican seasoning to the beef next time. But otherwise it was great. I will make it again.

I think this is an OK recipe, but a great base for making a killer Burrito Pie. It was a little bland. Next time I am going to season the taco meat with my homemade taco seasoning that I use when making tacos and burritos. This will give it the extra kick and authentic Mexican flavors. Also, I need to play around with the Taco Sauce or make my own. Good base, a lot of room for experimentation.
Used canned baked beans and just a sprinkle of taco seasoning. DH said it was a 10!

My 2 8 year old boys liked it. I loved it. I prepped and refrigeratored it a couple nights before. Come home, heated oven, put it in, and a quick 20 mins. later, YUM! oh, BTW, I used sharp cheddar, leftover refried beans, garlic, and beef -- no onions, etc. My kids' palates aren't that sophisticated yet!

I used a deep dish 13 x 9 lasagna baking dish and it all fit perfectly. I cooked the ingredients in a dutch oven which plenty of room for all the ingredients and made mixing easy. I have a deep 12 " skillet and this recipe would have been too much for it. I used one can of refried beans with jalapeños which I mixed into the mean mixture. The other can of traditional beans I spread on the tortillas as other have. Having that stand alone flavor was nice. The extra kick was perfect. My teenage kids loved it. Tastes much like a fast food meat, been and cheese burrito. Makes great left overs. Will definitely make again. Will try using one can of whole black beans.

I made this vegetarian by reconstituting 2.5 cups of TVP with 1/4 cup of soy sauce and hot water to cover. Sautéed an onion until lightly browned and added the typical Mexican cuisine spices, TVP and a can of mixed beans (rinsed). Once the TVP was browned, I added a can of Rotel and a can of enchilada sauce to thicken. I heated the tortillas on a cast iron pan until slightly crisp, and then layered the casserole with more enchilada sauce in a 13x9 baking dish. I only used about a half bag of shredded queso cheese for the entire thing since I don’t like too much cheese. Turned out great, everyone had a second helping. Nice change from tacos. Thanks!
I tried swapping the beef with fajita seasoned chicken and shrimp, and it was FABULOUS!!!!!! My whole family calls me Chef Daveed now ??

This was really good and made a lot for just 3 people, but I like to try recipes as they’re written the first time I make them. I’m definitely going to adjust it to make it smaller so that fits in a pie plate. The ingredients were a delicious combination. Thanks for the recipe.

Made this a few times it's great. Last night I changed a bit. Used ground turkey instead of chop meat, removed olives and added corn. Also used a bit more cheese. My family loves it. Thanks loads for sharing it.
Amazing meal, tasty and filling
very good!
Very tasty recipe! I used most of the ingredients I didn't add in the black olives, not a fan of them. I also top it with lettuce and sour cream once I plated it.
Very tasty recipe! I used most of the ingredients I didn't add in the black olives, not a fan of them. I also top it with lettuce and sour cream once I plated it.

We have had this several times now. The only change is we usually don't have taco sauce on hand, so I cook the ground beef with a packet of taco seasoning. It is good reheated, and also just cold if you are in a hurry. I have even cooked the meat ahead of time, then assembled it when I was ready to put it in the oven. We halve the recipe, it makes 4 nice size servings.
I skipped on the black olives because my husband hates them but the dish was delicious. I will definitely be making this again.

The dish was delish! I added some sliced Jalapeños, black beans and used retried black beans. Used the Mexican blend cheese fircthe layers and top. I omitted the black olives, since the family doesn’t care for them. It was a hit for sure!

I've made it twice in days delicious, quick, simple. That Ro-tel REALLY set it off...topped with sour cream...the Ro-tel didn't make it as spicy as i thought per recipe...so for those ho like a little kick/zest, jalapenos complimented the dish very well
Did it twice,

Excellent & easy!!! Just what I’m looking for! Everybody loved it. I served it first for just the two of us - and I will be making it Saturday for the SEC college football championship game! Go Dawgs!
This was amazing! I took out the black olives (hubby doesn't like) and put in black beans. Added some cayenne pepper (we like some heat). Very easy and will definitely make again!

I divided this recipe in half, made a vegetarian version on one side of the pan substituted black beans for the ground beef. A small cut-out of parchment paper made a good barrier and baked it in the same dish as the meat version.
This was so easy & makes alot! So delicious! Definitely a new easy favorite dinner of my family now
My boyfriend Jeff made it and I thought it was really great. I would for sure make this again. But I would have liked the tortilla's cooke a bit more.

Made this mostly as specified but had to add enchilada sauce to stretch the taco sauce, used one can of refried beans instead of 2, and I also crisped up the tortillas in a dry pan before layering. The tortillas still got gooey and generally unappetizing. I had one serving with sour cream, shredded lettuce and hot sauce but did not give this to my family, as I knew they would not like it. Very disappointed.
This is a family favorite! I always make one as stated in the recipe and one for the vegetarians in the family. On the veggie version, I just replace the beef with black beans and add a can of corn.
Made it as is. Wonderful. Just make sure you cook off the liquid before building it as another reviewer mentioned.
